explanation.expln: The axle tree of a bandy, loaded only with peacocks' feathers will break, if it be greatly overloaded.

explanation.expln: With peacock feathers light, you load the wain; Yet, heaped too high, the axle snaps in twain.

explanation.author: திருக்குறளார் வீ. முனிசாமி

உரை.expln: The axle tree of a bandy, loaded only with peacocks' feathers will break, if it be greatly overloaded.

உரை.author: Translation
உரை.expln: With peacock feathers light, you load the wain; Yet, heaped too high, the axle snaps in twain.

explanation.author: Author-1
explanation.expln: There will be an end to the life of him who, having climbed out to the end of a branch, ventures to go further.

explanation.author: Translation
explanation.expln: Who daring climbs, and would himself upraise Beyond the branch's tip, with life the forfeit pays.

explanation.author: மணக்குடவர்
explanation.expln: ஒரு மரத்தின் நுனிக்கொம்பேறினவர் தம்மள வறிந்து வைத்துப் பின்னும் மேலேறுவாராயின் அஃது அவர்தம்முயிர்க்கு இறுதியாகிவிடும். இஃது அரசன் தன்னாற் செல்லலாமெல்லையளவும் சென்றால் பின்பு மீள வேண்டுமென்றது. இதுவும் ஒரு வலியறிதல்.

'அளவு அறிந்து நிற்றல் வேண்டும்' என்றமையின் இதனான் வினைவலி அறியாவழிப்படும் இழுக்குக் கூறப்பட்டது.).

explanation.author: Author-1
explanation.expln: Let a man know the measure of his ability (to give), and let him give accordingly; such giving is the way to preserve his property.

explanation.author: Translation

explanation.expln: The prosperity of him who lives without knowing the measure (of his property), will perish, even while it seems to continue.

explanation.expln: Who prosperous lives and of enjoyment knows no bound, His seeming wealth, departing, nowhere shall be found.

உரை.expln: The prosperity of him who lives without knowing the measure (of his property), will perish, even while it seems to continue.

உரை.author: Translation
உரை.expln: Who prosperous lives and of enjoyment knows no bound, His seeming wealth, departing, nowhere shall be found.
